measured_by: cosine distance of 11-dimensional sensorimotor strength vectors from Lynott et al.’s (2020) norms
justification: “Each concept was therefore represented by an 11-dimensional vector of grounded sensorimotor experience, allowing us to compare two words by calculating the cosine distance between their vectors… we calculated sensorimotor distance based on multidimensional ratings of sensorimotor strength from Lynott and colleagues (2020).”
construct: sensorimotor overlap between category and member concepts

measured_by: cosine distance between log co-occurrence vectors derived from a 200-million-word subtitle corpus
justification: “Using a subtitle corpus consisting of 200 million words… each word in the corpus was represented as a vector of log co-occurrence frequencies… allowing us to compare two words by calculating the cosine distance between their vectors.”
construct: linguistic distributional overlap between category and member labels

measured_by: 5-point typicality rating scale (1 = very poor example, 5 = very good example)
justification: “Participants were asked to rate how good an example of the basic-level category… on a scale from 1 (very poor) to 5 (very good)… We then calculated the average typicality rating per category member.”
construct: object typicality within its basic-level category

measured_by: response time and accuracy in a label → picture category verification task
justification: “Participants judged (yes/no) whether the pictured item belonged to the category named in the preceding label… Response times were measured from the onset of the picture… and accuracy of each decision was also recorded.”
